News.Title: Essex Police: 39 people found dead in lorry container
News.Description: Police were called by the ambulance service shortly before 01:40 BST after the discovery at Waterglade Industrial Park in Eastern Avenue, Grays.The lorry driver, a 25-year-old man from Northern Ireland, has been arrested on suspicion of murder.
News.Info: Ch Supt Andrew Mariner said officers were trying to identify victims but anticipated We have arrested the lorry driver in connection with the incident, who remains in police custody as our inquiries continue,

News.Title: EU eyes Brexit flextension (again)
News.Description: The ball is not in our court. The balls are all stuck in the UK's net.
News.Info: The EU diplomat I was speaking to was frustrated. Hugely frustrated that the EU's newly negotiated Brexit deal was now stuck in limbo after Tuesday's votes in the House of Commons. He was irritated too that the prime minister said the next move would be decided in Brussels.

News.Title: Sourav Ganguly: Can former India captain score big as cricket chief?
News.Description: Sourav Ganguly, one of India's most successful cricket captains, takes over as president of the country's cricket board on Wednesday, kicking off a new chapter in its history, writes the BBC's Vikas Pandey in Delhi.
News.Info: Cricket is a religion in India and cricketers are often treated as gods.

News.Title: Leonardo da Vinci feud: The 'earlier' Mona Lisa mystery
News.Description: A painting of the Mona Lisa hangs above a fireplace in a London flat in the 1960s. Is this picture not only by Leonardo da Vinci, but also an earlier version of the world famous portrait that hangs in the Louvre Museum in Paris?
News.Info: Some people are convinced it is, and more than 50 years later, a bitter battle has erupted over both the ownership of the picture and the evidence about who painted it.
